content.description: First hold is a sloper dish about 7-8 feet off the ground, which requires a jump start. Crux is navigating the sloping rail, leading to good pockets up top.
content.protection: Two pads recommended. There is a smaller boulder, which is about half as high,  directly behind the main boulder which should be padded.
content.location: 1.6 miles up left fork on the left side. Boulder can be clearly seen from the road. Has a distinctive v shape. Requires river crossing.

content.description: Would be a 4 star problem if it weren't an eliminate.  Start with left hand in the giant pod, right hand on side pull.  Set your right heel by your hand.  The arret is out.  Cross right hand up into small pocket.  Drift over the the shallow dish, then fire up for the lip of the boulder.  Short and sweet.
content.protection: One pad is fine. Landing is flat.
content.location: From the parking, walk down through the coal and trash (a lot of rusty cans) to a boulder overlooking the river.  This is the top of The Beach boulder.  Access the small beach on the left..

content.description: Start with left hand in the pod, right hand on side-pull.  Set your right heel by your hand.  Drift  up and left using the side arret for your right hand and small pockets for your left.  Shuffle along the lip to a juggy left hand and top out
content.protection: One pad is fine, flat landing.
